glsa.title: Asterisk: IAX2 video frame buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: Asterisk contains a bug in the IAX2 channel driver making it vulnerable to the remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Asterisk is an open source implementation of a telephone private branch exchange (PBX).

description.p: Asterisk fails to properly check the length of truncated video frames in the IAX2 channel driver which results in a buffer overflow.

impact.p: An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted IAX2 video stream resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running Asterisk.

resolution.p: All Asterisk users should upgrade to the latest version:

references.uri: Corelabs Asterisk PBX truncated video frame vulnerability advisory
